newsitem.title: FRANCE: Daewoo to take big part of TMM's debt.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo to take big part of TMM's debt.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Electronics, lined up by Lagardere to buy the Thomson group's Thomson Multimedia unit for one franc, will assume a big portion of TMM's debt, officials involved in the deal said on Tuesday.
TMM's debt was 14 billion francs at the end of 1995.
"Daewoo will keep a significant portion of TMM's debt," Michel Jacob, managing director of Compagnie financiere Edmond de Rothschild, Daewoo's adviser, told a news conference.
The French government last week said it preferred Lagardere's offer for Thomson SA over a rival bid from Alcatel Alsthom.
Both bidders had lined up Asian partners to take up TMM, the consumer electronics division, and offered the government a symbolic one franc for the entire company.
Lagardere will focus on Thomson's defence electronics unit Thomson-CSF, merging it with its Matra missiles business.
The French government said it would recapitalise Thomson to the tune of 11 billion francs. Daewoo's chairman recently said that a large part of the recapitalisation would go to TMM.
